name: 書報討論（二）
restrict: 允許重複修 ◎課程開放上修
goals: Enable students to gain the reasoning ability of mathematical algorithms.
Equip students with the ability of electrical and electronic simulation design and demonstration.
Enable students to learn to plan the system from the original design to the execution of the completed system.
Learn to analyze problems and solve problems from the discussion process.
Generate ideas through brain storms and cultivate the ability to create inventions.
Achieve the goal of self-growth by learning from each other and adjusting research methods.
Allows students to learn communication skills and a cooperative attitude from open-ended discussions.
Learn professional ethics and service concepts through expert speeches.
Strengthen foreign language communication skills by a PPT presentation in English.
syllabus:
16 weeks (Lectures from Weeks 1 to 16)

Week #1: Syllabus and schedule of this course. Introduction to the development of electrical and electronic technology.

Weeks #2 to #6: Speeches by external experts or scholars

Weeks #7 to #9: Oral presentation of graduate students to report their research outcomes

Week #10: Speeches by external experts or scholars

Week #11: Oral presentation of graduate students to report their research outcomes

Week #12: Speeches by external experts or scholars

Week #13: Oral presentation of graduate students to report their research outcomes

Week #14: Speeches by external experts or scholars

Week #15: Oral presentation of graduate students to report their research outcomes

Week #16: Speeches by external experts or scholars

methodologies.note: Invite experts and scholars to give speeches
Open-ended discussion; students who ask questions during the class will be given extra credit points.
Issues raised by individual students will be resolved through open discussions.
Use multimedia for presentation and reporting.
Students present and submit their research or study reports.

grading.note: Students are encouraged to participate in the discussion. Those who ask questions during the class will be given extra credit points.
Students are required to sign-in and sign-out in this class. Absentees must take leave by providing a proof.
1. Oral presentation time is about 18 ~ 20 minutes. (60%) 2. A written report is required after listening to a speech in each class. (40%)

prerequisite: The course can be retaken ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
